laboratory_examinations.findings: Diffuse hypoattenuation of the liver consistent with fatty infiltration; diffuse fat stranding associated with the head of the pancreas; gallbladder, adrenal glands, spleen, kidneys, stomach, duodenum, small and large bowel appear normal; no fluid collection, no intra-abdominal fluid collection, ascites, pneumoperitoneum, or lymphadenopathy.
Anion gap elevated; elevated LFTs; hypokalemia.
Mixed bacterial flora (>= 3 colony types), consistent with skin and/or genital contamination.
